formFocus: The sound, when the part is changing from one to another
When I was bored by one I switched, but also sometimes when I was just curious what is in the other one. Combination of boredom and randomness I guess.
formComments: Sometimes I could see only one video (bad internet connection maybe).

formFocus: movements, sounds, buildings I recognized
content, and curiousity
formComments: Philly, vet dat het werkt. Het is alleen soms moeilijk om die andere video te zien omdat hij veel minder gehighlited is. Dus je moet dan heel goed kijken, en de kans dat je dan dus betere content mist is groter, in mijn ervaring.

formFocus: When the \'live\' video player film stopped being engaging (or at least the other one looked more interesting)
formComments: I\'ve clicked yes for record your own video but this is only very rare. - same therefore for uploading video. Could perhaps more scaled responses which, I imagine, will give you more helpful response info? In addition, just to clarify, put \'2\' for informative but that was more to do with the footage not being that informative rather than the method of interaction.  Hope a help and best of luck with rest of research.

formFocus: boredom
the curiosity
mainly colours and louder sounds
Changing scenes. Boats and trees.
Poor quality of the current video selected. New/different content in the other video
Engaging visuals
formComments:
I believe there was a bug, sometimes the video was just cut off. It wasn't dimmed, it was just cut off.
Secondly even though I might not use my mouse to focus on video, I still focus my attention and vision on it. Perhaps you should do some lab sessions and use eye tracking software.

formFocus: after looking at the same scene for a period of time to get whats going on.
formComments: I would like to see news in this way- however, using same sound, multiple pictures to flick between for more interest.

formFocus: The level of action
change of scene
movement , where things seemed to be happening
I changed according to what I perceived was more important among the two videos.
Bad Quality, not changing images
Wanting to see what was happening in the other one

to see more clearly something that appeared to attract my attention
to make the annoying sounds of the currently-playing video stop :) absolutely wicked result for the project, I'm very impressed! Nice going, Philo.
Movement of camera (pan), change of contrast and lights  and losing interest in the 1st feed.
formComments: Idea is great and project full of potential, in particular for big events which are well covered and allow multi-angle views of an action. It would be interesting to have information about the content producer displayed discretely on the player. That way the audience could vote on the quality of a source, and in time reward the owner for it's content, encouraging him to submit more videos in this system.

formFocus: a sudden change in activity, and the fact that when i changed to the other for a split second, there was music playing, so i went back to listen to it.
curiosity; change in scenery;
Mainly seeing some scenes not seen before that have a lot of things going on made me swich to them.
Audible speech caused me to   stay with current window more.
curson
curiosity
Unpleasant sound, repetition,
the information showed by the image.
action
formComments: camera angles and their sudden change grabbed attention more than what was being seen.

formFocus: I wanted to know what was going on in both videos, so I kept switching every time I saw something new developing.
The image of Elisabeth II.
Where things seemed a bit more active, engaging ie. the Queen leaving the palace

Sudden, or grand movements occurring in the other video player. Also, not knowing what was happening on other video player, "checking up" so to speak because it was too dimmed out. Dimmed out video player was too dim in my opinion, could make out shapes and movements, but would like to have seen the silent player a bit more clearly.
Perhaps my imagination, but I experienced significant differences in the sound volume levels when switching between players.
boredom/ short attention span
formComments: I don't like watching boats on rivers so I went for the horses.

formFocus: Interesting new stuff. The unfocussed player usually showed boring scenes like a boat moving slowly.
formComments: Succes met de laatste lootjes vanuit Amsterdam! :-)

formFocus: I changed the focus at random.
when the sounds no longer correlated with the video I was watching I would change focus to the one it did match up with
Out of curiosity.
formComments: It was a bit distorting, as the sound played did not seem to match the video in focus.

formFocus: More movement in another video or new (interesting) scenery in the other video
I liked the parade with the horsemen more than the one with the boats, so I switched accordingly.
formComments: I found the transitions of the sound a bit unpleasant, this should (in my opinion) be a little bit more gradual. I also think there was sometimes a large gap between the volumes, so that should also be remedied.

formFocus: Sometimes I was curious about the other video, other times the image of the focused video stopped briefly, causing me to change the focus to the other video.
movement / i switched to the other video if the camera was shaking or when it looked like something more interesting was happening in the other video
New parts of video and zooming in
No idea
Curiousity...I wanted to see what was going on in the other video...also tried to see an even amount of both videos.
When the sounds of the video was too disturbing I changed and hoped the other one would be more pleasant to listen to
Better audio, better view of events
framing or video stopping also audio
formComments: The subject and content of the videos was uninteresting, the technology may though have many uses like the crowd sourcing of video editing or the training of AI to mimic human audio visual focus and attention
